BiblioData.Title: METAL NITRATE CONVERSION METHOD
BiblioData.Abstract: A method is described for converting a supported metal nitrate into the corresponding supported metal oxide comprising heating the metal nitrate to effect its decomposition under a gas mixture that contains nitrous oxide and has an oxygen content of <5% by volume. The method provides very highly dispersed metal oxide on the support material. The metal oxide is useful as a catalyst or as a catalyst precursor.

Claims.P: 1. A method for converting a supported metal nitrate into the corresponding supported metal oxide comprising heating the metal nitrate to effect its decomposition under a gas mixture containing nitrous oxide and having an oxygen content of <5% by volume.

2. A method according to claim 1 wherein the metal nitrate is impregnated onto a support material from a solution and dried to remove the solvent before heating the metal nitrate to convert it to the corresponding metal oxide.
3. A method according to claim 1 or claim 2 wherein the gas mixture consists of one or more inert gases and nitrous oxide.
4. A method according to claim 3 wherein the inert gas is selected from nitrogen, helium or argon.
5. A method according to any one of claims 1 to 4 wherein the nitrous oxide concentration in the gas mixture is in the range 0.001 to 15% by volume.
6. A method according to any one of claims 1 to 5 wherein the supported metal nitrate is heated to a temperature in the range 100-1200<0>C.
7. A method according to any one of claims 1 to 6 wherein the metal nitrate is a transition metal nitrate.
8. A method according to any one of claims 1 to 7 wherein the metal nitrate is a nitrate of nickel, cobalt, copper, or iron.
9. A method according to any one of claims 1 to 8 wherein the support is a metal, carbon, metal oxide, mixed metal oxide or solid polymer support.
10. A method according to any one of claims 1 to 9 wherein the support is selected from alumina, metal-aluminate, silica, aluminosilicate, titania, zirconia or mixtures of these.

1 1. A method according to any one of claims 1 to 10 wherein the supported metal oxide is a reducible metal oxide, further comprising heating the supported metal oxide under a reducing gas stream to effect reduction of at least a part of the metal oxide.
12. A method according to claim 11 wherein the reducing gas stream comprises carbon monoxide and/or hydrogen.

13. A method according to claim 11 or claim 12 wherein the supported metal oxide is nickel oxide, cobalt oxide, copper oxide or iron oxide and the reduction is performed with a hydrogen-containing gas.
14. A supported oxide obtainable by the method of any one of claims 1 to 10.
15. A supported reduced metal oxide obtainable by the method of claims 1 1-13.
16. Use of the supported oxide prepared according to the method of claims 1 to 10 as a catalyst, catalyst precursor or sorbent.
17. Use of the supported reduced metal oxide prepared according to the method of claims 1 1 to 13 as a catalyst or sorbent.
18. Use according to claim 17 wherein the reduced metal oxide is a hydrogenation catalyst or a Fischer-Tropsch catalyst.
